TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit UnmanagedMemoryStream extends System.IO.Stream

summary.span: 提供从托管代码访问非托管内存块的能力。

span.span: Provides access to unmanaged blocks of memory from managed code.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此类支持使用现有的基于流的模型访问非托管内存，并且不需要将非托管内存中的内容复制到堆。This class supports access to unmanaged memory using the existing stream-based model and does not require that the contents in the unmanaged memory be copied to the heap. [!INCLUDE[note_unnecessary_dispose](~/includes/note-unnecessary-dispose.md)] ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用 类读取和写入非托管内存。The following code example demonstrates how to read from and write to unmanaged memory using the class. 使用 类分配并取消分配非托管内存块。A block of unmanaged memory is allocated and de-allocated using the class. [!code-csharp[System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream/cs/sample.cs#1)]

summary.span: 初始化 类的新实例。

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此构造函数创建 类的新实例，并在默认情况下将 属性设置为 `false`，并将 属性设置为 `true`。This constructor creates a new instance of the class, and by default sets the property to `false` and the property to `true`. 属性设置为 `length` 参数的值，并且无法更改。The property is set to the value of the `length` parameter and cannot be changed. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用 类读取和写入非托管内存。The following code example demonstrates how to read from and write to unmanaged memory using the class. 使用 类分配并取消分配非托管内存块。A block of unmanaged memory is allocated and de-allocated using the class. summary.span: 使用指定的位置、内存长度、内存总量和文件访问值初始化 类的新实例。

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified location, memory length, total amount of memory, and file access values.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `length` 参数定义当前使用的内存量。The `length` parameter defines the current amount of memory in use. 如果读取数据或将数据追加到流，则 `length` 值应等于要从中读取或保留的流中的有效数据量。If reading or appending data to the stream, the `length` value should be equal to the amount of valid data in the stream to be read from or preserved. 如果写入流，此值应为零。If writing to the stream, this value should be zero. `capacity` 参数指示可用内存总量。The `capacity` parameter indicates the amount of total memory available. 此值可以描述比指定长度长的区域，或指示可追加到的区域。This value can describe a region that is longer than the length specified, or indicate a region that can be appended to. 超出此值的任何写入尝试都将失败。Any attempt to write beyond this value will fail. `access` 参数设置 和 属性。The `access` parameter sets the , and properties. 请注意，指定 不保证流可写。Note that specifying does not guarantee that the stream will be writable. 访问参数允许实施者创建一个对象，该对象的实现可以匹配公开的实际流。The access parameters allow the implementer to create an object whose implementation can match the actual stream that is exposed. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用 类读取和写入非托管内存。The following code example demonstrates how to read from and write to unmanaged memory using the class. 使用 类分配并取消分配非托管内存块。A block of unmanaged memory is allocated and de-allocated using the class. [!code-csharp[System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream/cs/sample.cs#1)]

for accessing unmanaged memory.

summary.span: 获取流的长度（大小）或分配给流的内存总量（容量）。

span.span: Gets the stream length (size) or the total amount of memory assigned to a stream (capacity).
The size or capacity of the stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性返回提供给构造函数的 `capacity` 值。This property returns the `capacity` value provided to the constructor. 如果在初始化流时未指定 `capacity` 的值，则此属性将返回流的长度。If no `capacity` value was specified when the stream was initialized, this property returns the stream length.

span.span: The stream is closed.

span.span: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.

summary.span: 释放 使用的非托管资源，并选择性地释放托管资源。

span.span: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法由 public 方法和 方法调用。This method is called by the public method and the method. 调用受保护的 方法，并将 `disposing` 参数设置为 `true`。 invokes the protected method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`. 调用 `disposing` 设置为 `false`的 。 invokes with `disposing` set to `false`. 当 `disposing` 参数为 `true` 时，此方法释放该 引用的、由任何托管对象持有的全部资源。When the `disposing` parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this references. 此方法调用每个引用对象的 方法。This method invokes the method of each referenced object.

para.span: 可以由其他对象多次调用。

span.span: can be called multiple times by other objects.

para.span: 重写时，请注意不要引用先前在调用 之前已释放的对象。

span.span: When overriding be careful not to reference objects that have been previously disposed of in an earlier call to .

para.span: 有关如何实现 的详细信息，请参阅[实现 Dispose 方法](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md)。

span.span: For more information about how to implement , see [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).

para.span: 有关 和 的详细信息，请参阅[清理非托管资源](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)。

span.span: For more information about and , see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md).

summary.span: 重写 方法以便不执行任何操作。

span.span: Overrides the method so that no action is performed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法不对此类执行任何操作，但它作为 基类的一部分包含在内。This method performs no action for this class but is included as part of the base class. 由于所有数据都写入到 RAM，此方法是多余的。Since any data is written to RAM, this method is redundant.

span.span: The stream is closed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法等效于 构造函数。This method is equivalent to the constructor. 它支持在设置流变量之前需要初始化指针的方法，因此，不能调用参数化构造函数。It supports methods that need to initialize the pointer before setting stream variables and, therefore, cannot call the parameterized constructor. 此类方法应使用无参数构造函数，，初始化指针，然后调用 方法。Such methods should use the parameterless constructor, , initialize the pointer, and then invoke the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果自初始化流以来未发生更改，则此属性将返回提供给构造函数的长度值。If unchanged since the stream was initialized, this property returns the length value provided to the constructor. 如果对流进行了更改，则此属性将反映对数据长度所做的任何更改。If changes to the stream have occurred, this property reflects any changes to the length of the data. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用 类读取和写入非托管内存。The following code example demonstrates how to read from and write to unmanaged memory using the class. 使用 类分配并取消分配非托管内存块。A block of unmanaged memory is allocated and de-allocated using the class. Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline across NGen image boundaries")

summary.span: 获取或设置流中的当前位置。

span.span: Gets or sets the current position in a stream.
The current position in the stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 初始化流时，此属性设置为零。When a stream is initialized, this property is set to zero. 虽然你可以将流的位置设置为超出流的容量，但你将无法使用 和 方法访问该区域。Although you can set the position of the stream beyond the stream's capacity, you will not be able to access that area using the and methods. 将返回0， 将引发 。 will return 0 and will throw a . 此支持主要用于与基本流操作的设计和代码兼容性。This support is primarily for design and code compatibility with basic stream operations.

span.span: The stream is closed.

exception.span: 位置被设置为小于 0 的值，或者位置大于 或在添加到当前指针时导致溢出。

span.span: The position is set to a value that is less than zero, or the position is larger than or results in overflow when added to the current pointer.

summary.span: 获取或设置基于流中当前位置的指向流的字节指针。

span.span: Gets or sets a byte pointer to a stream based on the current position in the stream.
A byte pointer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要返回指向整个流的指针，请将 属性设置为零，然后调用此属性。To return a pointer to the entire stream, set the property to zero, and then call this property.

exception.span: 当前位置大于流的容量。

span.span: The current position is larger than the capacity of the stream.

exception.span: 所设置的位置不是当前流中的有效位置。

Public Overrides Function Read (buffer As Byte(), offset As Integer, count As Integer) As Integer

override this.Read : byte[] * int * int -> int
.method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 Read([out] unsigned int8[] buffer, int32 offset, int32 count) cil managed

param.name: buffer
param.span: 当此方法返回时，包含指定的字节数组，此数组中 和 ( + - 1) 之间的值被从当前源中读取的字节所替换。

span.span: When this method returns, contains the specified byte array with the values between and ( + - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.

param.span: 此参数未经初始化即被传递。

span.span: This parameter is passed uninitialized.

param.name: offset
param.span: 中的从零开始的字节偏移量，从此处开始存储从当前流中读取的数据。

span.span: The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.

param.name: count
param.span: 要从当前流中读取的最大字节数。

span.span: The maximum number of bytes to read from the current stream.

summary.span: 将指定数量的字节读入指定的数组。

span.span: Reads the specified number of bytes into the specified array.

returns.span: 读入缓冲区中的总字节数。

span.span: The total number of bytes read into the buffer.

returns.span: 如果许多字节当前不可用，则该数字可能小于要求的字节数；如果尚未到达流的末尾，则为零 (0)。

span.span: This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `offset` 参数提供 `array` 参数（缓冲区索引）中的字节偏移量，从此处开始读取，`count` 参数提供要从此流中读取的最大字节数。The `offset` parameter gives the offset of the byte in the `array` parameter (the buffer index) at which to begin reading, and the `count` parameter gives the maximum number of bytes to be read from this stream. 返回的值是读取的实际字节数，或者如果到达流的末尾，则为零。The returned value is the actual number of bytes read, or zero if the end of the stream is reached. 如果读取操作成功，则流的当前位置将按读取的字节数提前。If the read operation is successful, the current position of the stream is advanced by the number of bytes read. 如果发生异常，则流的当前位置不变。If an exception occurs, the current position of the stream is unchanged. 仅在到达流的末尾后， 方法返回零。The method returns zero only after reaching the end of the stream. 否则， 始终从流中读取至少一个字节，然后返回。Otherwise, always reads at least one byte from the stream before returning. 如果在调用 时流中没有可用数据，则该方法将一直阻止到至少有一个字节的数据返回。If no data is available from the stream upon a call to , the method will block until at least one byte of data can be returned. 即使尚未到达流的末尾，实现也可以自由返回比请求更少的字节。An implementation is free to return fewer bytes than requested even if the end of the stream has not been reached. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用 类读取和写入非托管内存。The following code example demonstrates how to read from and write to unmanaged memory using the class. 使用 类分配并取消分配非托管内存块。A block of unmanaged memory is allocated and de-allocated using the class. [!code-csharp[System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream/cs/sample.cs#1)]

span.span: The stream is closed.
The underlying memory does not support reading.

param.name: value
param.span: 流的长度。

span.span: The length of the stream.

summary.span: 将流的长度设置为指定的值。

span.span: Sets the length of a stream to a specified value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果给定值小于流的当前长度，则流将被截断。If the given value is less than the current length of the stream, the stream is truncated. 如果给定的值大于流的当前长度，则会扩展流。If the given value is larger than the current length of the stream, the stream is expanded. 如果流已展开，则新旧长度之间的流内容不确定。If the stream is expanded, the contents of the stream between the old and the new lengths are undefined. 流必须支持写入和查找 才能工作。A stream must support both writing and seeking for to work.
